page.title: 04Ecology (Conservation)
page.content: The main threat to the environment here is urbanisation- i.e. the rapid growth of Sleights. However, the area contains mostly the older part of Sleights and there is less threat from development. The area above Sleights is in the North Yorkshire Moors National Park, and little conservation work is needed. The only woodland is on steep and unstable land and there is little threat from agriculture. Almost all the moorland on the north side of the valley was re-claimed for forestry many years ago. The River Esk is Yorkshire's only Salmon river and fishing rights are guarded fiercely by the holders. The river is protected to a large extent from pollution and overfishing by the National Park authorities and the Yorkshire Water Authority.
